qas.question: What kind of student was Karlheinz Brandenburg?
When did Karlheinz start working on digitmal music compression?
Where did Bradenburg become an assistant professor at?
Who did Brandenburg work with in music compression?
When did Brandenburg join the Fraunhofen Institute?

context: As a <a0_0>doctoral<a0_0/> student at Germany's University of Erlangen-Nuremberg, Karlheinz Brandenburg began working on digital music compression in the <a1_0>early 1980s<a1_0/>, focusing on how people perceive music. He completed his doctoral work in 1989. MP3 is directly descended from OCF and PXFM, representing the outcome of the collaboration of Brandenburg—working as a postdoc at AT&T-Bell Labs with James D. Johnston ("JJ") of AT&T-Bell Labs—with the Fraunhofer Institut for Integrated Circuits, Erlangen, with relatively minor contributions from the MP2 branch of psychoacoustic sub-band coders. In 1990, Brandenburg became an assistant professor at <a2_0>Erlangen-Nuremberg<a2_0/>. While there, he continued to work on music compression with scientists at the <a3_0>Fraunhofer Society<a3_0/> (in <a4_0>1993<a4_0/> he joined the staff of the Fraunhofer Institute).
